website_summaries.verdict: If you don't mind a high price for a device best-suited to a single task, the SteelSeries H Wireless Headset is one of the better wireless gaming headsets you can buy.
pros: ChatMix and LiveMix features balance game sounds with clear voice audio
cons: Sound suffers a a bit with music outside of games

customer_reviews.title: Not good.
customer_reviews.text: Missing parts and this was obvious, should not have been sold.
customer_reviews.author: Mr G.

customer_reviews.title: Literally one the best headsets I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: Literally one the best headsets I've ever used, extremely comfortable and fantastic range and battery life. The different cables provided compensate for every situation meaning there's never a point where you'll find yourself unable to use the headset. Batteries are easy to switch out, so one stays in the headset and the other charges in the dock. Been using for at least a month now and the headset only gets better.
customer_reviews.author: David M

customer_reviews.title: One of the best gaming headsets I have own.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is awesome. Comfortable and light weight. Not a big fan of this style of mic but the headset sounds is great. Even with music tuning the EQ, sounds are clear and great. bad thing about this is the battery and dock charger. Docking charger sometimes will show it has half it battery left but the headset died due to low battery. Love the concept of switching out battery when gaming. Also dont leave the display on the box on, mine lcd display has ghosting text from burn through. I can always see the playstation text even when I switch it to PC.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Chau

customer_reviews.title: This is a great wireless headset, but not worth $300.  Wait for the price to drop.
customer_reviews.text: My first impressions of this wireless headset is if this headset didn't cost $300 at the time of purchase, this review would easily be 5 stars. This headset has great functionality, however after first impressions, i'm subtracting 1 star due primarily due sound quality you are getting for the price. It's good, but not $300 good. On the other hand, i'm thinking that the sound quality of this wireless headset is lacking in that area to compensate for battery life. The functionality of this wireless headset definitely beats all other competitors in it's class. I definately would recommend purchasing this wireless headset and I'll update this review, after I've had a chance to test thoroughly.
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: Coming From PX5...
customer_reviews.text: Coming From PX5 Headset... Pros: Surpasses the PX5 in every audio criteria. The transmitter doesn't stomp on your wifi - unlike the PX5. Very comfortable; does get steamy in the earcups but its tolerable. Swapable batteries is a deciding factor for me over buying the A50 The Transmitter just looks awesome. Cons: Wish it had bluetooth. Pricey but hey, get what you pay for. Conclusion: I'm planing on getting in on VR in a big way and needed a wireless, quality gaming headset. The Series H met all my requirements and I highly recommend them to anyone who can afford them. By my research, the Series H seems to be the best wireless gaming headset currently available.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, one of the best options for gaming headsets.
customer_reviews.text: I love this headset. Don't misunderstand when you see the four star rating. Overall the unit is probably one of the best wireless headsets out there. Unfortunately, that does not mean it is without fault. Pros: Sturdy and durable feel Soft ear cups Great sound Backup battery is a fantastic feature left out on other units Retractable microphone keeps it out of the way Cons: Microphone is bad Ear cups are a little small (I have large ears) Padding on the top of the headset feels a little too smuchy. Overall these are one of your best options. Do your research and choose wisely.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: The Best.  Period!!
customer_reviews.text: Best gaming headset I've ever used...period!!! The sound is so clear and the channel separation makes finding those bad guys a breeze. It's just a well though out design. If you've used the first gen. SteelSeries wireless headsets, fear not, these actually work and work amazingly well! No more crappy usb drivers. You definitely get your monies worth, and the two batteries is pure genius, clean and simple. I've read some reviews that stated some issues with the volume being too low, but I haven't encountered any of that, these things crank!
customer_reviews.author: Ed F.

customer_reviews.title: They're ok, i'd suggest researching other products
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for a week now, and I like it. A few notes: - Pro: Looks nice, sturdy, padded for comfort. Clear, full vibrant sounds when wired analog in (not wireless anymore). - Con: Heavy, after a long session my head is due for a massage. The circular ear muffs weren't a good design choice imo. It is perhaps a bit too small and snug, makes it uncomfortable because I have earrings. Wireless sound is no less than analog, but there is a noticeable static from the left, maybe interference with the microphone. Final thoughts: I like it, but it would not be worth a $300.
customer_reviews.author: Duy

customer_reviews.title: Great expensive headphones with lots of settings.
customer_reviews.text: Great all around headset. Great for gaming and Music. Is comfy but does get a little uncomfy at long gaming sessions. Expensive. sound and voice when gaming are great. Freinds have no problem hearing me. Set up is a little more complex as there are lots of setting to get proper sound just make sure you try several options as the instructions are good but again just a lot therer. I have this and the PLYR and the sony Gold. Cant go wrong with these but if you dont want to spend this much go for the PLYRs. I do recommend these as you wont be dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bemis

customer_reviews.title: Great headset. Unreliable Warranty
customer_reviews.text: Got the headset back in 15 Dec 2014. Got Square Trade 4 year P.C. peripherals extended Warranty. The headset battery stopped charging around Nov 2018. I had it shipped back for repairs and was returned 10 Dec 2018 - Unrepairable. So.... what is the point of warranty if you can’t claim it?
customer_reviews.author: Savvy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but not without problems.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality headset with great mic clarity. Love the two batteries it comes with so I don't experience any downtime. It doesn't pick up a lot of room noise either which is good. The only problem I have is that occasionally when trying to turn on the headset, it beeps as if it turned on but doesn't turn on. I have to hold down the button (and I hear a small clicking sound repeatedly as if it's trying to turn on) and eventually after a few seconds it will kick on. Slightly annoying but doesn't make me hate it. Otherwise it works well and is extremely comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Merritt

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good. The sound quality is excellent
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. The sound quality is excellent. The best part is that the H series is more like a universal wireless headset that is designed to work with any source (consoles , pc or receiver....be them digital or analog inputs). The sound quality is good and they aren't heavy on your head. The quality of the microphone is excellent even with using the onboard audio on my computer ( I don't use the usb. I used optical in and chat out connectors only ). I am very happy with my purchase. Yes, they are pricey but it was a gamble that paid off.
customer_reviews.author: Earl A. Kacin

customer_reviews.title: Headband and headphone pieces have a weak connection
customer_reviews.text: With about 6-8 months of use, there were cracks all over the connection between the headband and earpieces that eventually broke. I had to deal with one side of my headphones dangling off the side, and only holding on due to the wires. I quickly replaced them with the new Arctis 3's (~$75) also by Steelseries that seem to have a much more refined and robust design. I say that because they seem to be using the same design and materials for Artics 7's which are 200+ dollars.
customer_reviews.author: shabudin maknojia

customer_reviews.title: Not loud enough
customer_reviews.text: The battery swapping feature works great. Good build quality too. I'm giving it 3 stars because its just not loud enough. The default settings seem to produce the loudest volume and it goes down from there with any tinkering with balancing levels between chat and game volume. My volume rocker has been maxed out since day one. Even then, it doesn't come close to pushing out a reasonable volume, for many audio sources I can't make out the dialog. In all other respects this is the perfect headset, but the audio is a complete miss.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C. Dorn

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic & Terrible.
customer_reviews.text: This headset was the best headset I had ever had until it stopped working after a few months. SteelSeries support replaced them under warranty and I was happy again. Now the replacement pair constantly connects and disconnects and is extremely frustrating. I contacted support and they offered me 10% off a new pair. :( No thank you. These were almost 300$ and they don't last 12 months.
customer_reviews.author: William G. Mote II

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, lightweight, quality mic and good wireless signal. I came from a G930, which I had to return to Logitech multiple times to repair issues. I know 3 other people who have owned the G930, and all reported similar or identical issues. The H is the best wireless headset on the market. 4 stars because the headset is very tight, steelseries states you should bend and work them to be the desired tightness as they have an internal metal band made for this purpose, also it could be 50 dollars cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Guy4Game

customer_reviews.title: Not as good for a PC Gaming Headset
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a better Gaming headset Then the Corsair Vengeance 2100 Dolby 7.1 Wireless. Sorry to say the SteelSeries H Wireless Gaming Headset did not work for me as I had hoped. Low audio and I could not get the Dolby 7.1 Surround Sound for PC to work. @ about $250.00 they were not worth it. I found I would have to go with a wired headset. The Sennheiser PC 363D High Performance Surround Sound Gaming Headset was much better one to get
customer_reviews.author: Wetpaws

customer_reviews.title: Worth?
customer_reviews.text: It's okay...Honestly for the price-point it's way too expensive. Pros: Wireless A+++ Surround is...okay nothing special Headband is padded nicely (No aching of head) Replaceable/Chargeable batteries (2 of them) Durable (?) Still working with no broken parts (SINCE JULY 15, 2015). Hoping this headset lasts for a very long time for the price I paid for. Cons: Need more room in cups area (Ears touch red part) Leads to aching on ears plasticky? plasticy? plastiky?! Surround is....okay nothing special $$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$ I would put 268 of them but...Nah, I won't TL;DR - Buy if you have $$$ to spare and like laying on bed/couch all day bingeing on Netflix and other videos
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: I have kind of bigger ears and these fit over them just fine. They were a bit snug at first but ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm really loving these headphones. I was stuck between choosing this one and the Astro A50's. I have kind of bigger ears and these fit over them just fine. They were a bit snug at first but I feel like they've loosened up and they are very comfortable now. Really great sound quality. I think they low range is great as well. The only issue I've really noticed is that the sound volume is lower when running the optic cable. I still run the optic because it's plenty loud for me. Great spacial awareness in FPS games as well.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel W

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money for quality.
customer_reviews.text: Did hours and hours of reviews on the Headset I may use to game and listen to music and movies. I watched linus tech tips. and he's bang on accurate how he describes these. Max Volume is good for me. but if you like it loud, these have a limit. Zero distortion. you can't blow these up. Comfortable after a week or so. two batteries, the Hub is easy and awesome. I'm tekky but don't like confusing stuff. I'm keeping these babies. I got what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: tjrpt6

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality and super comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband for Christmas. He is a gamer and plays on every platform. I did some research and this headset was top rated. He loves them. I also hit a day that these were discounted a bit which was nice. I also got the Xbox One adapter which works great too. He recommends also purchasing the Bluetooth receiver (Harmon Cardon - which is available here on amazon) so that you can also link them to your phone and other devices. Battery is long lasting and comes with two.
customer_reviews.author: Jettichicken

customer_reviews.title: Best headset I've owned
customer_reviews.text: Never owned a wireless headset before - glad I started with this one. It is expensive but flat-out the best headset I've ever owned. I love the extra battery it comes with and the settings are easy to tweak and setup was stupid easy. Sound is fantastic and I can get about 100 ft away before I get any oddness with the reception. Battery life is great and you don't kill the battery by charging it while its in use because the backup is charging. Love it would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Tim K.

customer_reviews.title: Best Out There
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my old Logitech G930's with these after searching for the best wireless headphones (with a built in mic). Linus and I agree on this point, these are the best wireless headphones on the market. Size, style, build quality, and fit are perfect. Range is about double that of my G930s. Battery packs charge quickly (and basically allow for uninterrupted use, while never needing a cable). Of course, sound quality is also excellent (I am no audiophile, but these are remarkably better than my G930s and the pair of Astro50s my buddy had).
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Y.

customer_reviews.title: The extra battery is useful for longer gaming sessions
customer_reviews.text: It's clearly a high quality headset, but wasn't as much of an upgrade as I'd hoped for the price. The extra battery is useful for longer gaming sessions. Update: I've come to dislike this headset. It regularly cuts out for me now when playing games using Discord. It's clearly some kind of USB issue I can't resolve.
customer_reviews.author: BKuhl

customer_reviews.title: Little expensive but very nice headset
customer_reviews.text: Nicely built. Works as imtended. A little expensive but if your seriois about gaming and want to use on multiple platforms, this is a great set of headphones. Very comfortable for the amount of fime I've wore them. Longest so far is 3hrs straight without an issue. Battery life is amazing for a wireless set. About 20hrs on a battery so far while gaming. Very nice headset. I exclusivey play games. I didnt buy thos headset to watch movies or listen to music
customer_reviews.author: Lakotah

customer_reviews.title: This head set is simply awesome, I have had it for over a year ...
customer_reviews.text: This head set is simply awesome, I have had it for over a year now and I cant imagine my self using any of my old headsets. having wireless all the time is by far the best fetcher on this headset, I which more headsets had this fetcher. the sound and comfort is great, compared to my old Logitech g930 this headset always seems to stay on my head, you could be shaking your head as hard as you can and it will not move at all. I love how the mic hides inside, which is great if you are simply lying in bed reading a book.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice while they lasted.
customer_reviews.text: It started off nice, but after a while the battery connections started to go loose. Have to get them just right in both the charger and the headphones to get them to work. Headphones will occasionally disconnect from the battery coming loose. I guess as long as you don't expect them to last they are great.
customer_reviews.author: JCH

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY! WILL BREAK!
customer_reviews.text: Updated. Headset is not worth it. The headset is very tight and the main rode which holds the earphones in place and slides in and out is made of cheap plastic. It holds all the stress as the headset streatches over your head. It snapped and now the very expensive headset is worthless. DO NOT BUY! Will Break!
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: The receiver seems to have broken after a few uses. I needed these for a conference demo and when I plugged the receiver unit into the power station it would not power back on. Nothing I have tried has worked. They luckily work without power so I was able to use them wired but had sunk money into a great optical setup. Returning these for a refund. Over-engineered and would merit the price if they worked perfectly but I seem to be far from the only person having issues.
customer_reviews.author: Anton S.

customer_reviews.title: These headphones are amazing. Easy to set up and they have no ...
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are amazing. Easy to set up and they have no background noise like most wireless headsets I've tried. They aren't ideal for music if you are an audiophile, but for games and movies the surround is top notch. Best solution for charging batteries of any headset ever. One will always be charging so if it dies, you just switch them out, more wireless headsets need this. These are expensive, but they are worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Bdiddytampa

customer_reviews.title: Best Wireless gaming headset you can buy.
customer_reviews.text: With the above being said this headset succumbs to a couple of crucial faults that audiophiles and consumers alike will want to know about. The faults are as follows -DB limitations cause the headphones to be limited to only medium levels of volume playback -Mic quality for voice chat is absolutely horrendous If you can live with the above faults these are the single best wireless multimedia surround sound headphone available. Yes they are better then Astro A50's (Unless you like High DB)
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Pappas

customer_reviews.title: Simply excellent for gaming.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic sound!! Highly recommend these!! I can't play without them. Mic quality is very good as well. Wireless connectivity works without a hitch. I have had these for about 6 months now and played with them daily. Simply excellent sound and quality. My friends are jealous with their mediocre turtle beach. I'm not sure there is an all in one system that can come close to these. The Astros are okay but too boomy and very limited in controls.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Best wireless 7.1 headset out there
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality for a wireless headset. Could be a bit louder, but I promise that max volume is plenty loud enough for everyday use. Having two batteries (one charges in the transmitter while you use the other) is the biggest upside to this headset. It takes five seconds to swap the dead battery out for the other. Infinite battery life = win. Apparently, the mic sounds 'buzzy' when used with an Xbox One, but on PC using USB for the microphone input, I've had no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Wheat

customer_reviews.title: Great headset for gaming
customer_reviews.text: I love the headset overall. Why 4 stars? It cost me more than I really wanted to pay although it does work as advertised. Mostly. The only glitch I've found is that after replacing the battery it can be cranky sometimes when trying to turn it on. I think it has some mechanical sensors on the cover plates and it takes a bit of playing to get it to work. Being wireless is great though and being able to dynamically adjust the sound levels from voice and the game is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Bernie

customer_reviews.title: Better than Astros
customer_reviews.text: Wireless, rechargeable battery (2 of them) last a long time, never have to stop to recharge unlike Astros. Bass is not overbearing unlike Astros so can hear all the little details. People get mad in games when I hear them coming up behind me. Music and movies are great also, use these in the morning to watch shows while wife still sleeping. Great set of headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Shuoink

customer_reviews.title: One of the best headsets I have purchased!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best headsets I have yet to purchase, and my batteries started to act weird and go bad, Steelseries sent me a new set of batteries and I am ready to rock for another 2-3 years with these! :-) Only thing I might say is a negative is that they are fairly heavy compared to most other headsets I have tried or owned in the recent or past. But that's probably due to the components to allow for the swapping of the rechargeable batteries (a feature I absolutely love!).
customer_reviews.author: Amerisun

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Sound But Fragile and Expensive
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this headset. The sound is excellent for a wireless model. The two interchangeable batteries are revolutionary, it's the feature that made me decide to buy this product. The only reason I didn't rate this five stars is due to the hefty price. Edit: After about a year and a half, the plastic by the earpieces is cracked and they are currently held together by Gorilla Tape.
customer_reviews.author: Sporadic

customer_reviews.title: Best wireless headset I've used
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite headsets so far. I've been using it for a month with no issues so far. Sound is great. My friends are a little tired of hearing me use the bathroom so I use the mute microphone button. I cook and clean while talking on skype with my best friends. It's amazing for gaming as well. 10/10 headset, well worth the money. Sidenote: I had the Logitech G35? The wireless one, before this. The logitech wireless headset died within 2 weeks with constant disconnect issues because I live in an apartment building where people use microwaves. No issues with this headset whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Best headset!
customer_reviews.text: I love this headset, I've had it for almost 3 months now and they sound the best. The Astro A50 are a little more comfortable, but didn't sound as good, plus they had connection problems. I ended up returning the Astro A50 and got the SteelSeries. I ended up getting Brainwavz HM5 Velor Memory Foam Replacements Earpads, because the SteelSeries original leather pads tend to make your ears a little hot after a long use.
customer_reviews.author: Big F

customer_reviews.title: Awesome headphones
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of wireless headphones, and honestly I am glad I went with these particular ones. Sounds great, easy to setup, very comfortable. The only problem I have with them is how ridiculously quiet they are when connected through optical. I feel forced to use the USB connection to be able to hear anything (especially if there is background noise.) So if you're on the fence (and have the money), I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: OhmsTen

customer_reviews.title: SteelSeries, will you marry me?
customer_reviews.text: I have a full 7.1 surround sound setup at my house, and I thought that there was nothing better than having your game blast at you through full surround. I have never been so happy to be wrong. These are comfortable beyond measure, and the sound quality gave me goosebumps the first time I put them on. The ease of use and display are magnificent. Multiple batteries that can be charged on the station so you can keep going even when one of your batteries fail. I can't possibly conjure the words to adequately describe my love for these headphones. If you do nothing else this year, **Buy these headphones** You will not regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible for use on Xbox one
customer_reviews.text: Horrible for use on Xbox one, the mic sucks. The sound quality is pretty good but the mic not functioning properly with a Xbox one did me in. Returned item and ordered turtle beach x800, no far no complaints and it's totally wireless.
customer_reviews.author: nathan graham

customer_reviews.title: (The volume knob is also the select button) 2) The retractable mic feels flimsy and doesn't like to stay in place
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this since I had a pair of Logitech wireless gaming headset that always cut out and couldn't keep a connection, but I don't have that problem with these. Two minor nitpicks: 1) Without reading the instructions, the setup isn't entirely clear. (The volume knob is also the select button) 2) The retractable mic feels flimsy and doesn't like to stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: Keii

customer_reviews.title: Can't hear my voice through mic
customer_reviews.text: No sidetone (ability to hear yourself through mic). Deal breaker for me. Set up seems redundant/confusing as there are 2 power sources (ac and usb) and 2 audio sources (usb and digital) and unplugging one or the other doesn't seem to change anything? I may switch to Tritons as the warheads for my 360 remain the best headset I've bought.
customer_reviews.author: George Hard R Martin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Gaming Headset!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Good sound, very good mic capabilities, and I really like how u can customize everything through the E Q. I would have given It five stars except the only downfall was that for some reason the game sound will automatically sometimes get louder by itself....don't know why, but It only lasts a few seconds. All In all I would buy It all over again compared to everything else out there.
customer_reviews.author: Adam M. Marken

customer_reviews.title: Great headset but not super impressive
customer_reviews.text: Great headset but not super impressive, it lacks some oomph. As many people have mentioned, the headset can't handle very bassy situations. Easy to use and to set up. The battery swapping option is very handy. It doesn't look very sturdy but it actually is. It is more or less comfortable but not for long sessions of gaming. Overall is a decent headset for the money, I did researched many in the market and this was the best choice. I have and will recommend this headset to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Alien-Vampire

customer_reviews.title: Amazing wireless with absolutely ZERO feedback or hiss
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal headset. Don't have the patience to write a full review, but you will not be sorry if you buy this headset. If you're considering it, just do it. Amazing wireless with absolutely ZERO feedback or hiss, interchangeable batteries are awesome and sound quality is amazing overall (not the greatest for music, but I haven't playe with the EQs yet). Best headset I've ever used by far - if these ever break I will immediately order another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Receiver is dead
customer_reviews.text: The headset is fine but receiver for the headset just died. I tried to plug in somewhere else with no luck now i have a headset that wont work without the receiver. I tried to contact Steel Series with no answer i will never buy this garage again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael F.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't support Xbox One and PS4 at the same time.
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about this headset minus the fact you cannot hook up both Xbox One and PS4 at the same time! That's the main reason why I bought these. As a non-discriminatory gamer, I game on both PS4, and Xbox One, and PC. However the headset isn't the solution I was looking for. Waste of money really! But it redeems itself by sounding incredible and working flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Vahdyx

customer_reviews.title: Awesome features but missing on a few things.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these and the Astro A50's at the same time to compare them. Hands down the Astro's sound better for gaming. Surround is not as immersive and I found it harder to pinpoint things around me. Livemix feature sounded intriguing but did not work at all. Comfort wise they were OK. I hated the fact my ears were pinned down inside of them while they fit fine on the A50's.
customer_reviews.author: JLG

customer_reviews.title: Logitech sucks
customer_reviews.text: I own the Logitech G930 and I have so many problems with them I can't even begin. I will openly say that these at least to me do not sound as good as the G930. They do however connect with ease wirelessly, can be setup with multiple sources, and have an awesome range. I use these primarily for voice chat and they do not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Rudarudd

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, the ear cuffs are incredibly comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Okay so i am editing a previous review I wrote about these. Because at first they were amazing. And they still are incredibly comfortable and easy to use. But, now I'm having difficulties after five or six months of continued use. They have a connection issue now. I'm not sure with what. But when I'm connected to my ps4 it will disconnect and reconnect constantly threw the entire time I'm playing a video game or just watching a movie. I'm very disappointed that spending 300$ on these headphones has gone to waste, and wouldn't recommend buying them
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use on PC, PS4 and Xbox One
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an easy to use setup that provided me with long battery life and the SteelSeries H Wireless Headset fits the bill. The headset produces great sound and it may lack bass more than other headsets, but it doesn't bother me. There is a great sense of surround sound when using the headphones and you won't be interrupted since it comes with a spare battery that uses the base to recharge it. Top quality.
customer_reviews.author: TWISM

customer_reviews.title: One of the best headset you will love!
customer_reviews.text: Currently using this for my laptop and the quality has been fantastic, I'm always on "Immersion" while watching videos and "Music" when I'm jamming. I don't have optical audio in my laptop but once my ps4 comes in a couple of days I'll update my review but for now 10/10 build quality is great I haven't seen any wear on it every since I started using it, quality is accurate meaning no lag no hassle since it has an awesome wireless setup <3
customer_reviews.author: Reymart T.

customer_reviews.title: id buy again and again.
customer_reviews.text: i love this headset. easy to configure. i use it for my pc and console at the same time. can listen to both inputs at once while using the mic. i can play all day, sometimes almost all weekend without swapping the battery. and they give you two batteries. so nice! i dont have a single complaint about this headset
customer_reviews.author: Chef Tragon

customer_reviews.title: so far I really like the sound
customer_reviews.text: Used them for two weeks before writing this review, so far I really like the sound. The retractable mic is a great feature. The only thing I was not impressed with is the length on the cord from the headset to the controller, it must be 4 feet long, it does get in the way from time to time. I will replace that with a shorter one later.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing. Sound quality, balance, everything about these are great. $300 are worth it. My only con is the share (or 3.5mm jack) for listening from other sources. The quality isn't as great, but perhaps that's because I was connected via my TV I bought 8 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: This headset was pretty great, with only a few issues with the ...
customer_reviews.text: This headset was pretty great, with only a few issues with the batteries being sometimes difficult to position correctly in the headset/charger, for just over a year untill the plastic above the right earcup exploded as I was taking it off of my head. Being as it's over $300 dollars I was always careful with it. Being over a few monthes out of warranty SteelSeries denied my RMA. I will not be purchasing from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Had to send one set in for replacement because the ...
customer_reviews.text: Had to send one set in for replacement because the mic wasn't picking up sound at all after a few months of usage. The entire process took around a month to complete. if I had a redo I wouldn't get them, especially considering the price you drop them.
customer_reviews.author: King John

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: Zero complaints other than slightly confusing input/output configuration and labels. I've had these for months now and love the quality, range, and comfort. Being able to swap batteries in about 10 seconds is fantastic, especially with the base station that is always charging the included spare. You basically never run out of battery power because of this.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Better mic would give better review.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and fit. Love the batteries, cell phone, cheap replacement if you look at the type. Lasts 12 hours or more. Mic is worst I've had in years. I get better mic sound out of a $3 fisher price mic taped to my chest.
customer_reviews.author: IceKohl

customer_reviews.title: Great for use with flight simulators
customer_reviews.text: Am using for a flight simulator. Comfortable for hours; great audio response (especially with simulated static!); quick and easy to swap-out the rechargeable battery; control box has the recharger; retractable microphone works very well mechanically and at reducing background noise.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Gerow

customer_reviews.title: owned since 2015 and still work
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a pair for 2 years now and they work just as well as when I purchased them, which surprises me cause I figured I'd have to replace the removable batteries but I haven't had too
customer_reviews.author: jordan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headset
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Pros: Brilliant 7.1 surround sound Crisp Very very comfortable Wireless Easy to set on all systems Cons: Not too loud Bass is just ok Brilliant product and would highly recommend. In comparison with the astro a50 this headset is more comfortable. Better build quality and lighter.
customer_reviews.author: physiognomist

customer_reviews.title: 0 for 2
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 of these and both have broken in the same place at the swivel point. Very disappointing since the sound quality is good.
customer_reviews.author: MysteryChuck

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect! I got a battery which did not work at first but the seller sent me another one for free. I could not want any other headset.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel C.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Best headset you can buy
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't get any better than this. I use them at work for conference calls and have a second pair at home for gaming. Very comfortable. Great sound. Very convenient to swap batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Hahn

customer_reviews.title: Simply Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This headset is the BEST I have had, and I have had a bunch or wireless and hardwired headsets over the years... Great sound quality, extremely comfortable to wear, even for 8+ hours at a time gaming. Great range too, as I can walk thru my 2-story house and never lose signal. Simply love them!
customer_reviews.author: Randy L. Witham

customer_reviews.title: I still hear him bragging to his friend's about how amazing this headset is and how much he loves it
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband well over a year ago. while the batteries are starting to wear down from his constant use, the headset is very sound and he loves it for then any headset he has ever owned. I still hear him bragging to his friend's about how amazing this headset is and how much he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Pamella Moore

customer_reviews.title: "True to the Word" Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Purchased headphones as a birthday gift for my son. He researched these headphones for several months and stated they are the best on the market. They have meet his expectations. He enjoys the comfort of the ear cups and the audio is very clear when listening to music and gaming. Great battery life is a plus, plus. I have to say these headphones are one of my best purchases so far this year. Kudos to Steelseries H.
customer_reviews.author: CAC313

customer_reviews.title: Greatest headphones ever
customer_reviews.text: They are amazing. Sound porn. You can really tell the difference from say turtle beaches. Battery life is great. They last about a full day of use, (12 hours of gaming), and it comes with 2.
customer_reviews.author: Devinnez

customer_reviews.title: Great head phones
customer_reviews.text: Great head phones, bought them used for a great deal, but would have still been happy even buying them new with their superior quality and build. They are super comfy i can wear'em for hours without even noticing that they're on my head. The sound quality is nice and the surround sound surprisingly works, if i have a helicopter or something creating constant noise in the game I can close my eyes and spin my character around, then ill stop spinning and try to guess where the helicopter is at and i've always gotten it right, its pretty awesome
customer_reviews.author: lol brae brae

customer_reviews.title: Very good headset with questionable build quality
customer_reviews.text: Very good sound, very comfortable. Had a slight buzzing noise which was only audible when no sound was playing. Two batteries were great and easily swappable. Two months out of warranty the plastic connector between the band and the ear cups started to go, which I gather is a fairly common problem with these. Once that happened it was only a short amount of time before the headset died. RIP. Note that the warranty is 2 years in the EU, 1 in the US.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Headset is wonderful and was exactly what I hoped for it last ...
customer_reviews.text: Headset is wonderful and was exactly what I hoped for it last for along time and the switchable battery makes it never a problem. It being wireless is also a plus because I don't have to deal with any cables while at my computer or walking around my house. For range when having it in the front room I can wonder my house and never loose signal, the only issue arises is if I leave it on one side of the house and walk to other. But that is expected. Everything sounds wonderful and it easy to connect I recommend this to any one who is looking for a good gaming headset.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Lad

customer_reviews.title: Can't use any other headphones
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair of these over a year ago and just came back to buy another one because I couldn't stand to use anything else at my office. Worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob M Tabak

customer_reviews.title: BEST WIRELESS HEADSET
customer_reviews.text: It's amazing, the sound quality is incredible, it's really confortable, you can use it for long hours without trouble, the battery charges really fast, it comes with 2 batteries, it means you literally have infinite wireless without need of using cable on your headset! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Nícolas Lopes

customer_reviews.title: Best head phones I've owned
customer_reviews.text: Best head phones I've owned. the only thing I wish they had was side tone. I can hear its working if I have them on with absolutely no noise playing but once some sound is playing through them the side tone is far to quiet to be heard.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best stable gaming headset i have ever had , using these for 3 years without any problems
customer_reviews.author: abdulla alzayani

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: I've had these headphones going on several months now and they continue to impress me every day. They are easy to program, and the sound is fantastic. I use them to run on the treadmill and watch TV or to run outdoors, and I have no issues with any delay. It's a hefty investment, but I do believe they were well worth the money. Also, the headphones are extremely comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Just_a_Person

customer_reviews.title: Very good headset - can wear for long period of time
customer_reviews.text: Very good headset - can wear for long period of time, easy setup, battery lasts a long time and it comes with a second battery for easy charging/swapping. I use a wireless mouse and have my router setup near and have had zero lag/interference from any of the devices. It's pricey, but well worth it for a wireless headset.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Super Wireless Headset!
customer_reviews.text: This headset lives up to all the promo. Fits comfortably, easy to set up and use. The controller box fits nicely on my side table and has great functionality. The two batteries keep it running without loss of time.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick P. Ours

customer_reviews.title: So far I enjoy these, great headset
customer_reviews.text: So far I enjoy these, great headset. Comfy, light, love how it comes with two batteries so that you never have to be plugged in. Only small complaint is the max volume level, why it is loud enough, isn't the loudest and some may find that disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon R DeGuire

customer_reviews.title: Device stops working after one year
customer_reviews.text: The general product is very high quality, but the charger is made of cheap coils that will stop working after about a year (around the time the warranty will expire), so you will be unable to charge your device batteries, making the device unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Victor F.

customer_reviews.title: So Far Excellent
customer_reviews.text: So Far Excellent great fit, extended range and a 24 son who is very happy using it in his gaming!
customer_reviews.author: Stormygirl

customer_reviews.title: best head set ive used
customer_reviews.text: best head set ive used . I am coming from an astro a40 . then an a50 . I loved the a40s hated the a50s . so i went this route and never looked back since . with the two battery and great comfort i would say get this to any person who wants awesome sound .
customer_reviews.author: Charles H.

customer_reviews.title: Love them! would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Love them! would buy again. walk around my whole house with out loosing connection, sound is great, mic is great. battery swapping is awesome as you are always wireless.
customer_reviews.author: orlando castillo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The item is as described, arrived in a timely manner. Would buy from seller again. No issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Great set for your Head... but
customer_reviews.text: I've used them for a bit now and I have to say these are the best headset I've ever used. Really comfortable on the ears and head piece. Easy to setup with a true wireless system. Only issue I'm having is a static sound in the left earcup. Not necessarily a deal breaker but maybe I just got a bad set. Also for the price I expected the Mic quality to be a bit better.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Abshire

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise great product. Lots of little extras
customer_reviews.text: I only wish you could hook the receiver box up to the Xbox One. There's always a chance that Microsoft will patch it later as there was recently released a wireless headset where the headset control box plugs into the console and the headset is wireless to that box. Otherwise great product. Lots of little extras.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are amazing, I love them. Totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Very solid surround experience
customer_reviews.text: The Dolby 7.1 is awesome and the sound is very clean. When I was thinking about buying a wireless gaming headset I got between this and the astro a50, and, after much consideration, I made the right choice. The mixer is awesome and can be configured in many ways so your experience can be optimized for what intend to do next (like music, gaming, chatting, etc). The only downside is the volume that is lower than what I expected, but it still goes higher than what I intend to use.
customer_reviews.author: Leandro Pastore

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones, for a price.
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend these to anyone. The range is great, the sound quality is great, and the mic is decent. The dual battery design makes it so that you never had to plug them in, and they're rarely off. You should still consider this carefully, the price is steep.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: Sad to see them go
customer_reviews.text: Sound amazing, cannot wear for any period of time. Ear cups are very shallow, pressure applied by headband is applied directly to ears, not to padding. Sound is incredible for wireless set, I really wish I could keep wearing them. I did not get any experience with mic.
customer_reviews.author: R. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Must Have
customer_reviews.text: I was kinda scared on wasting all that cash , but damn this headset kicks ass , it's like the gods are singing in your head
customer_reviews.author: Alex Kooper

customer_reviews.title: Best Gaming Headset
customer_reviews.text: Just got these and love them. The double battery is an awesome idea. You never have to worry about having a dead headset. The volume level is fine for gaming. Certain games comes through loud enough and no reason to max out. There meant for gaming and sounds excellent. Best headsets I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: PWilliams

customer_reviews.title: Not that comfortable
customer_reviews.text: After an hour of wear they start to get uncomfortable on the top of my head Updated review: the two buttons on the front of the charging unit have stopped working. I can't open the menu or change the volume
customer_reviews.author: B R

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, not Ultra loud but enough to hurt your ears on max volume...Superb features and sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Maxjenius

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Headphones!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good headset. I would definitely recommend it. Although they weren't very loud until they broke in. But they are plenty loud now. Surround sound works great for call of duty and other games. I use it on ps4 and pc
customer_reviews.author: William Osburn

customer_reviews.title: Needs an 11 on the volume knob. 10 doesn't cut it.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound but they just weren't loud enough. I don't always listen to music, But when I do it needs to be loud.
customer_reviews.author: VicDog

customer_reviews.title: hands down the BEST headset I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: hands down the BEST headset I have ever owned, (and I have had many) sound is amazing, very comfortable even for long periods of time. Worth the $$$
customer_reviews.author: R. Alley

product_meta.title: steelseri 61298 - SteelSeries H Wireless Gaming Headset - Black (61298)
feature_bullets: SteelSeries next-generation speaker drivers for rich sound and low-frequency punch
Closed-back earcups for superior accuracy, clarity, and detail
Dolby virtual 7.1 surround sound technology places you in the game
Retractable, directional mic on gooseneck with mute light
Two hot-swappable Li-Ion batteries for unlimited play
